section.name: Running the sample HST site
section.p: The show the possiblities of the HST in practice, a complete JSP site has been made available for download. It is in fact the currently running onehippo.com website. To run it, you also need a combined CMS 7 / Repository 2 with initial content in it.

subsection.name: Download and run Repository 2 / CMS 7.
subsection.p: Download the onehippo.com ECM as a war.
Deploy the war in your favorite web server, like Tomcat or JBoss. See here for more information on deploying the ECM.

subsection.name: Download and run the HST site.
subsection.p: Download the onehippo.com site as war.
Deploy the war in your favorite web server. The current distribution assumes that some components are provided
If you are running the site in Tomcat, make sure the following components are available in the Tomcat installation:

ul.li: javax.transaction: Tomcat out-of-the-box lacks javax.transaction package, however the HST depends on it. The package may be installed for example in Tomcats shared/lib directory. An example of such a package is Genronimo's geronimo-spec-jta-1.0.1B-rc2.jar, which may be obtained under through the Apache Geronimo project as with Maven 2 groupID geronimo-spec and artifactId geronimo-spec-jta

Standard core and formatting taglibs: the example site uses two standard taglibs, core (c:) and formatting (fmt:). These taglibs should be provided by the container and may be obtained through hte Apache Jakarta project. Version should be 1.1.2 or higher.
